Description:
The FHIR CarePlan resource is a broad container for summarizing the plan of treatment for a patient. It includes links to the Condition Resource (the patient's long term problem list) and the Goal Resource (the patient's longitudinal goals) as well as in-line detail about upcoming appointments and upcoming orders.

This resource is designed for outpatient-related care plan data.

The search interaction enables the lookup of one or more CarePlan resources, filtered by the specified parameters.

category.Name: category
category.Description: Type of plan. 736271009 should be used to search for outpatient care plans.

patient.Name: patient
patient.Description: Patient FHIR ID for the patient associated with the care plan.

status.Name: status
status.Description: The status of the care plan.

Bundle.Name: Bundle
Bundle.Description: Resource bundle. For more information, refer to the FHIR specification.

CarePlan.Name: CarePlan
CarePlan.Description: An instance of the R4 CarePlan resource.

activity.Name: activity
activity.Description: Actions to occur as part of the care plan.

detail.Name: detail
detail.Description: A simple summary of the planned activity.

code.Name: code
code.Description: The display name for a given activity.

description.Name: description
description.Description: This is the note associated with the task. It typically contains a user's notes and a brief summary of what needs to happen.

goal.Name: goal
goal.Description: Identifies goals that this activity is intended to contribute towards meeting. Reference to a Goal resource. This will never be more than 1 Goal resource.

kind.Name: kind
kind.Description: A description of the kind of resource the care plan activity is representing. We always use the "Task" value.

Next due date.Name: extension
Next due date.Description: The next date the patient task is due. Only used by Patient tasks.

performer.Name: performer
performer.Description: Identifies who's expected to be involved in the activity. Reference to a Practitioner or Patient resource. This is the user that is currently responsible for the activity. For patient tasks the patient is the performer.

reasonReference.Name: reasonReference
reasonReference.Description: Reference to a Condition resource that justifies the inclusion of this activity as part of the care plan.

scheduledPeriod.Name: scheduledPeriod
scheduledPeriod.Description: The period upon which the described activity is to occur.

scheduledTiming.Name: scheduledTiming
scheduledTiming.Description: The timing upon which the described activity is to occur.

status.Name: status
status.Description: Identifies what progress is being made for the specific activity.

Task type.Name: extension
Task type.Description: For patient tasks this is the specific task documentation type which determines the task completion buttons that can be used.

Priority.Name: extension
Priority.Description: The priority for a given activity. This value is mapped from a list uniquely defined by each Epic community member.

progress.Name: progress
progress.Description: Notes about the progress of the activity.

addresses.Name: addresses
addresses.Description: The list of health issues this CarePlan addresses. Reference to a Condition resource or resources.

author.Name: author
author.Description: Reference to a Practitioner resource that represents the user who created the care plan.

category.Name: category
category.Description: What "kind" of plan this is to support differentiation between multiple co-existing plans; e.g. "Home health", "psychiatric", "asthma", "disease management", "wellness plan", etc. SNOMED 736271009 should be used.

contributor.Name: contributor
contributor.Description: The list of users who have modified data on the care plan. Reference to a Practitioner resource or resources.

Episode.Name: extension
Episode.Description: The name of the episode if the care plan is linked to one.

goal.Name: goal
goal.Description: Reference to a Goal resource or resources associated with this CarePlan.

intent.Name: intent
intent.Description: The level of authority/intentionality associated with the CarePlan. Always "Plan."

period.Name: period
period.Description: The timeframe where the care plan was in use.

status.Name: status
status.Description: Whether the plan is currently being acted upon, represents future intentions or is now a historical record.

subject.Name: subject
subject.Description: The patient or subject of this care plan.

Tasktype.Name: extension
Tasktype.Description: For patient tasks this is the specific task documentation type which determines the task completion buttons that can be used.

title.Name: title
title.Description: The display name given to the care plan.
